materials.name: Instructor Information
materials.description: Professor: Tedd Wong, E-mail Address: twong76@mtsac.edu, Office Phone: 909-274-4425, Office Location: 61-2505, Office Hours: 6:30 pm MW before class and 8:25 MW after class.

materials.name: Required Materials
materials.description: Textbook: Engineering Mechanics: Statics, by R.C. Hibbeler, 15th ed. Other materials: Standard note-taking supplies, a scientific calculator (NCEES/SAT/ACT approved e.g., TI-36, TI-84), a straight-edge. Quad rule pad (graph paper) is highly recommended.

materials.name: Course Description
materials.description: Vector approach to static equilibrium of rigid bodies, forces, couples in two and three- dimensional space. Application of equilibrium principles to trusses, frames, and machines. Calculation of center-of-mass and centroid. Friction, moment of inertia, distributed and concentrated loads. Forces in cables and beams. Fluid statics. Introduction to virtual work. PRE-REQUISITES: PHYS 4A and MATH 181 (Calc 2).

materials.name: Lecture L1: General Principles
materials.description: Topic covers Chapter 1: General Principles.

materials.name: Lecture L2: Force Vectors
materials.description: Topics cover Chapter 2.1: Scalars and Vectors, Chapter 2.2: Vector Operations, Chapter 2.3: Vector Addition of Forces, Chapter 2.4: Addition of Coplanar Forces.

materials.name: Holiday
materials.description: There is a holiday this week.

materials.name: Lecture L3: Cartesian Vectors and Operations
materials.description: Topics cover Chapter 2.5: Cartesian Vectors, Chapter 2.6: Addition of Cartesian Vectors, Chapter 2.7: Position Vectors, Chapter 2.8: Line Force Vectors, Chapter 2.9: Dot Product.

materials.name: Lecture L4: Particle Equilibrium
materials.description: Topics cover Chapter 3.1: Equilibrium of Particle, Chapter 3.2: FBD of Particle.

materials.name: Lecture L5: Force Systems
materials.description: Topics cover Chapter 3.3: Coplanar Forces, Chapter 3.4: 3-D Force.

assignments.name: Midterm #1
assignments.description: First midterm exam of the semester.

materials.name: Midterm Review
materials.description: Review session for Midterm #1.

materials.name: Lecture L7: Moments
materials.description: Topics cover Chapter 4.1: Scalar Moments, Chapter 4.2: Principle of Moments.

materials.name: Lecture L8: Vector Moments
materials.description: Topics cover Chapter 4.3: Cross Product, Chapter 4.4: Vector Moments About a Point-3D, Chapter 4.5: Vector Moments About an Axis-3D.

materials.name: Lecture L9: Moments and Couples
materials.description: Topics cover Chapter 4.6: Moment of a Couple, Chapter 4.7: Simplify Force and Couple - Force and Moment.

modules.module_name: Week 7: Equilibrium of a Rigid Body

materials.description: Topics cover Chapter 4.8: Simplify Force and Couple - Force and Distance, Chapter 4.9: Distributed Loading - Force and Distance.

materials.description: Topics cover Chapter 5.1: Equilibrium of Rigid Body, Chapter 5.2: FBD of Rigid Body, Chapter 5.3: Equations of Equilibrium.

materials.description: Topics cover Chapter 5.4: 2 and 3 Force Members, Chapter 5.5: FBD of Force Members, Chapter 5.6: Equations of Equilibrium, Chapter 5.7: Constraints and Determinacy.

assignments.name: Midterm #2

materials.description: Topics cover Chapter 6.1: Trusses, Chapter 6.2: MOJ (Method of Joints), Chapter 6.3: Zero Force Members.

modules.module_name: Week 10: Structural Analysis - Frames and Machines

materials.name: Lecture L15 & L16: Frames and Machines
materials.description: Topics cover Chapter 6.6: Frames and Machines.

materials.name: Lecture L17b: Shear and Moment

materials.name: Lecture L18: Dry Friction

modules.module_name: Week 15: Center of Gravity and Moment of Inertia
